text: Mihaíl Anastasákis (; born 3 December 1994) is a Greek track and field athlete specialising in the hammer throw. He finished fourth at the 2016 European Championships. His personal best in the event is 77.72 metres set in Nikiti in 2017. ==International competitions== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |rowspan=2|2011 |World Youth Championships |Lille, France |8th |Hammer throw (5 kg) |69.64 m |- |European Youth Olympic Festival |Trabzon, Turkey |8th |Hammer throw (5 kg) |69.26 m |- |2013 |European Junior Championships |Rieti, Italy |6th |Hammer throw (6 kg) |72.44 m |- |2015 |European U23 Championships |Tallinn, Estonia |4th |Hammer throw |71.64 m |- |rowspan=2|2016 |European Championships |Amsterdam, Netherlands |4th |Hammer throw |75.89 m |- |Olympic Games |Rio de Janeiro, Brazil |20th (q) |Hammer throw |71.28 m |- |2017 |World Championships |London, United Kingdom |28th (q) |Hammer throw |70.94 m |- |2018 |European Championships |Berlin, Germany |9th |Hammer throw |73.33 m |- |2019 |World Championships |Doha, Qatar |13th (q) |Hammer throw |75.07 m |} ==References== Category:1994 births Category:Living people Category:Greek male hammer throwers Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2016 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic athletes of Greece
title: Mihail Anastasakis
